remarks: The Exponential Law for topological spaces.  The "currying" function ` F ` is a homeomorphism on function spaces when ` J ` and ` K ` are exponentiable spaces (by ~ xkococn , it is sufficient to assume that ` J , K ` are locally compact to ensure exponentiability).  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Apr-2015.)  (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 23-Aug-2015.)
